issues.description: The solution’s Rideable interface and implementations introduce an `int speed` parameter in `messageOnRide(int speed)`, whereas the problem statement and template expect a parameterless `messageOnRide(): String`. This mismatch will prevent students from compiling and implementing the intended interface contract and breaks the Main class’s calls to `r.messageOnRide()`.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Rideable interface and its implementations with the specification by removing the `int speed` parameter. Define `String messageOnRide()` in Rideable, and update Pig and Seal to implement `messageOnRide()` returning exactly “Riding on [Animal Type] [name]”.
